career.name: Doctor
career.stats: Start with Tough -1, Sharp +1, Steady +0, then increase your choice by 1.
career.description: You make a living fixing—or at least ameliorating—the physical ills of life. Name a specialty and describe your practice. Lifestyle: Well-off

recovery.movebody: When you receive appropriate medical treatment (GM's call), recover Suffer Harm. When you build a basic human relationship with someone (their player's call), recover one of Take a Risk, Keep it Together, or Study, your choice.

move.movebody: When you study a dead body, ask the GM what killed it. If the death was mundane, the GM will describe the circumstances. If the death was supernatural, the GM will tell you the nearest mundane cause, plus what doesn’t fit that cause.

When you give a dying person your undivided attention you buy them time. They won’t die for at least a few moments and the GM will tell you what you can do to keep them alive longer—maybe even avoid death entirely.
Off the top of your head you know the medical history of everyone in town.
When you provide immediate medical aid to someone who’s suffered harm, they roll with your Sharp instead of their Tough.
When you treat someone with a permanent condition, ask the GM how the condition could be removed. They will always give you a way (though it may take some work).

history.event: I saved _______'s life, they know they're in good hands with me. They take +1 to Keep it Together in your presence.
_______ has shown an interest in my work which I appreciate. They get +1 Sharp.
I trust _______ to hear me out when the work is too much. They take +1 when aiding you.

career.name: Reporter
career.stats: Start with Tough +0, Sharp +1, Steady -1, then increase your choice by 1.
career.description: You write stories, maybe with an investigative bent, for a periodical—name it, describe its topic(s), and choose a news beat (crime, politics, or high society maybe). Lifestyle: middle class

recovery.movebody: When you receive appropriate medical treatment (GM's call), recover Suffer Harm. When you build a basic human relationship with someone (their player's call), recover one of Take a Risk, Keep it Together, or Study, your choice.

move.movebody: When you talk to someone and can carefully study them you can ask the GM if they’re lying about any given statement, as often as you please. The GM will answer truthfully.

You’re known for bringing down people (deserving or not) with your stories. If you report on something with the barest of evidence you can be sure the proper authorities (local police, most likely) will get involved as soon as your story hits. This may not be a good thing, but at least they can’t kill you without somebody asking questions, right?
You’re used to taking your own photos. Unless you’re physically denied a working camera, you always have photographic evidence of every place you’ve been. Not that everyone will believe it.

You always know who’s in the know. When you seek information, you can always ask the GM “who might know more about this?” The GM will answer truthfully, including where that person can usually be found.

history.event: I filed a story on _____ and it made them look good—they owe me. They take +1 to aid you.
_____ helped me out with a particularly tough story, we worked well together. They take +1 to aid you.
I always give _____ a copy of my notes, just in case someone comes after me. They take +1 to aid you.
